bookTitle: Lessons in Chemistry
bookDesc: The No. 1 Sunday Times bestseller and BBC Between the Covers Book Club pick by Bonnie Garmus

bookTitle: Project Hail Mary
bookDesc: If you like a lot of science in your science fiction, Andy Weir is the writer for you.

bookTitle: Children of Time by Adrian Tchaikovsky
bookDesc: Children of Time is a joy from start to finish. Entertaining, smart, surprising and unexpectedly human.' - Patrick Ness, author of A Monster Calls

bookTitle: This is How You Lose the Time War
bookDesc: An epic time-travelling love story, winner of the Hugo and Nebula Awards for Best Novella by Amal El-Mohtar

bookTitle: Exhalation by Ted Chiang
bookDesc: One of the most exciting writers in science fiction . . . CHIANG Although dark in premise, these parables - threaded through with references to ancient mythology and folklore - are filled with hope and humanism: a balm for anxious souls.' DAILY TELEGRAPH

bookTitle: The Martian
bookDesc: Stranded on Mars, one astronaut fights to survive by Andy Weir

bookTitle: Ready Player Two
bookDesc: The highly anticipated sequel to READY PLAYER ONE by Ernest Cline

bookTitle: Babylon's Ashes
bookDesc: A revolution brewing for generations has begun in fire. It will end in blood.

bookTitle: The Sirens Of Titan by Kurt Vonnegut
bookDesc: When Winston Niles Rumfoord flies his spaceship into a chrono-synclastic infundibulum he is converted into pure energy and only materializes when his waveforms intercept Earth or some other planet.

bookTitle: The Long Way to a Small, Angry Planet: Wayfarers 1 by Becky Chambers
bookDesc: The beloved debut novel that will restore your faith in humanity

bookTitle: Into the Black by Evan Currie
bookDesc: The beloved debut novel that will restore your faith in humanity

bookTitle: The Wandering Earth by Cixin Liu
bookDesc: The Sun is dying. Earth will perish too, consumed by the star in its final death throes. But rather than abandon their planet, humanity builds 12,000 mountainous fusion engines to propel the Earth out of orbit and onto a centuries-long voyage to Proxima Centaurai...

bookTitle: Tabby McTat by Julia Donaldson
bookDesc: A heart-warming picture book story of friendship, loyalty - and kittens from the creator of The Gruffalo! Me, you and the old guitar.

bookTitle: No More Nappies: A Potty-Training Book by Marion Cocklico
bookDesc: The Big Steps series is designed to help little ones cope with everyday experiences in their lives.

bookTitle: The Breakfast Club Adventures: The Beast Beyond the Fence by Marcus Rashford
bookDesc: Dive into an exciting and mysterious adventure full of fun-filled friendships, fantastical creatures and incredible investigations by the #1 bestselling author Marcus Rashford!

bookTitle: The Gruffalo by Julia Donaldson
bookDesc: Walk further into the deep dark wood, and discover what happens when a quick-witted mouse comes face to face with an owl, a snake . . . and a hungry Gruffalo!

bookTitle: Mermaids by Fiona Watt
bookDesc: Dive into an undersea world where mermaids gather pearls, meet a mermaid queen, find a treasure chest and dive with seals

bookTitle: Monkey Puzzle by Julia Donaldson
bookDesc: Where is Monkey's mummy? It's not too much fun being lost in the jungle, and little monkey wants his mum.

bookTitle: The Snail and the Whale by Julia Donaldson
bookDesc: The Snail and the Whale is a delightful tale of adventure and friendship by the unparalleled picture book partnership of Julia Donaldson and Axel Scheffler, creators of The Gruffalo.

bookTitle: Superworm by Julia Donaldson
bookDesc: The wiggly, squiggly superhero is now available in a paperback edition. Superworm is super-long. Superworm is super-strong.

bookTitle: Axel Scheffler On the Farm by Axel Scheffler
bookDesc: Little ones can join in the fun On the Farm by pulling out the sliders, jiggling the animals and making all the different noises! Quack along with the ducks, moo with the cows and neigh with the horses.

bookTitle: The Day I Fell Into a Fairytale: The bestselling classic adventure by Ben Miller
bookDesc: Lana loves stories. Especially the ones she and her brother, Harrison, share in their make-believe games. But when Harrison decides he's too grown-up to play with Lana she finds herself feeling lonely. Until something magical happens . . .

bookTitle: Lady With A Spear
bookDesc: 1954. First Edition. 198 pages. Black and white photographic dust jacket over blue cloth with a photographic black and white frontis and plates throughout.

bookTitle: The Diary of a Young Girl: The Definitive Edition of the World's Most Famous Diary by Anne Frank
bookDesc: The Definitive Edition of the World's Most Famous Diary by Anne Frank

bookTitle: The Light We Carry: Overcoming In Uncertain Times by Michelle Obama
bookDesc: Michelle Obama believes that when we light up for others, we can illuminate the richness and potential of the world around us, discovering deeper truths and new pathways for progress.

bookTitle: SAS Great Escapes Two: Six Untold Epic Escapes Made by World War Two Heroes by Damien Lewis
bookDesc: SAS Great Escapes Two recounts the hitherto untold stories of six of the most dramatic and daring escapes executed by the world's most famous fighting force during WWII.

bookTitle: This is Going to Hurt: Now a major BBC comedy-drama by Adam Kay
bookDesc: Welcome to the life of a junior doctor: 97-hour weeks, life and death decisions, a constant tsunami of bodily fluids, and the hospital parking meter earns more than you.

bookTitle: Shoe Dog: A Memoir by the Creator of NIKE by Phil Knight
bookDesc: The best book I read last year was Shoe Dog, by Nike's Phil Knight. Phil is a very wise, intelligent and competitive fellow who is also a gifted storyteller' Warren Buffett

bookTitle: Spare by Prince Harry The Duke of Sussex
bookDesc: It was one of the most searing images of the twentieth century: two young boys, two princes, walking behind their mother's coffin as the world watched in sorrow - and horror.
bookAuthor: Prince Harry The Duke of Sussex

bookTitle: Elizabeth: An intimate portrait from the writer who knew her and her family for over fifty years by Gyles Brandreth
bookDesc: Over the next fifty years he met her many times, both at public and at private events. Through his friendship with the Duke of Edinburgh, he was given privileged access to Elizabeth II.

bookTitle: A Gypsy In Auschwitz: How I Survived the Horrors of the 'Forgotten Holocaust' by Otto Rosenberg
bookDesc: Otto Rosenberg is 9 and living in Berlin, poor but happy, when his family are first detained.

bookTitle: Steve Jobs: The Exclusive Biography by Walter Isaacson
bookDesc: Based on more than forty interviews with Steve Jobs conducted over two years - as well as interviews with more than a hundred family members, friends, adversaries, competitors, and colleagues - this is the acclaimed, internationally bestselling biography of the ultimate icon of inventiveness.
